content: Is there a list of the servers that will be at (or available) for testing at atlanta connectathon?
General-purpose servers, or servers participating in specific tracks?

I would like to add to that:

Is there anyone with a 4.0.0 server that supports transaction bundle uploads and websocket subscriptions?

Lamprey Networks has one that can be used at http://fhir.lnihealth.com/hapi/fhir (for the devices track). It's a late enough version of HAPI that uploads of valueSampledData no longer give an error. However, don't expect uploaded data to remain; it will be purged now and then.

General-purpose servers, or servers participating in specific tracks?

I expected the normal list https://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Publicly_Available_FHIR_Servers_for_testing would be augmented by some servers that are only going to be appearing at FHIR connectathon in atlanta.
They may be specialized for a given track but if you can use them for your stuff that is usually ok. Otherwise they wouldn't be on the list...I suppose.
conman does have the ability to record servers against tracks, for those using it...

I have a HAPI 4.0.0 server at http://fhir.hausamconsulting.org/r4. I haven't done it yet, but I can enable the websocket (and other subscription channels. I typically don't purge data (although, of course, I might have to consider that if the db size becomes large enough).
